activities.loc: Courtroom D, Fourth Floor - North Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mario Nathaniel Howard

records.addlTxt: Calendar call on March 7, 2023 at 02:15 pm.

1:48 PM Defendant Mario Nathaniel Howard not in court.  Attorney Shanna Sanders appeared with legal intern McKenna Mathie by video for Mario Nathaniel Howard.  Prosecuting attorney Emmeline Lee appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant to sign bond by November 11, 2022. Defendant pleads not guilty. Matter to be set.
Adjourned initial appearance on November 2, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Activity: Initial appearance
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Court orders Signature bond in the amount of $1,000 to be signed by October 21, 2022 with conditions: May not possess any weapons or firearms. No contact directly or indirectly with victim P.B.J., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. Adjourned initial appearance set for November 2, 2022 at 10:00 AM
